art_direction: Vintage photo realism of a subterranean folk horror cult, rendered from a bird's eye view with flickering, fire-lit scenes in a palette of muted reds and greens.

scenes.title: A Song Beneath the Storm
scenes.text: The sky broke above the city, a tantrum of thunder and lightning that sent the grid into a fitful sleep. Down here, the emergency lights painted the tunnel in a sickly, pastoral yellow, then they too died, leaving only the damp and the dark. The rumble from above was like the sound of a giant tilling the soil of the streets. And then, another sound began to wind its way through the iron veins of the earth—a low, rhythmic chant, a harvest song for a crop I could not imagine.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A lone figure stands in the center of a completely dark subway tunnel, the beam of a weak flashlight cutting a small circle on the wet ground in front of them. The tracks stretch into blackness in both directions.

choices.text: Follow the strange, melodic chanting.
Seek silence and a different path.

scenes.title: The Tithe of Steel
scenes.text: The song led me to a cavernous, forgotten station, a cathedral of decay. Its vaulted ceilings drank the light of a dozen flickering torches. Figures moved with a placid grace below, their bodies clad in the faded canvas of old work uniforms. They were not praying, but working. With long-handled brushes, they painted the rails with a thick, syrupy liquid the color of old wine, tracing sigils that coiled like sleeping serpents upon the steel. The air, thick with ozone and rust, carried their tune—a gentle, methodical hymn.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A grand, derelict subway station is filled with robed figures holding torches. In the center, several of them are on their knees, painting glowing red symbols onto the train tracks with buckets of dark liquid.

choices.text: Conceal myself and observe their work.
Try to slip past in the shadows.

scenes.title: The Verdant Blight
scenes.text: I chose the quiet dark, a service tunnel where water wept from the ceiling in a slow, patient rhythm. The silence was a blanket, but a thin one. Beneath it, I felt a hum, a vibration in the soles of my feet. The walls here were not barren; they bloomed with a strange, fungal pasture. Luminous green growths, like shelves of flesh, pulsed with a soft, internal light, casting the corridor in the spectral glow of a false dawn. They were the source of the hum, a silent chorus to the vocal one I'd fled.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A narrow, curved maintenance tunnel whose walls are covered in large, plate-like fungi that glow with a soft green light. A lone figure is seen from above, hesitating in the middle of the path.

choices.text: Reach out and touch the glowing fungus.
Give the growths a wide berth and continue on.

scenes.title: The Gleaning
scenes.text: From the sanctuary of a rusted kiosk, I watched. The last sigil was complete. The chanting swelled, and with a great groaning of wheels, a derelict train car was pushed by the figures onto the consecrated track. They treated it not as a machine, but as a prized bull being led to offering. The doors were hauled open. It was a cattle car. Inside, packed in the dark, were human bodies, pale and still. The figures entered, their movements unhurried, as if tending a garden, their hands reaching for the silent crop within.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. Hidden from view, the camera looks down as cultists open the side of an old subway car. The inside is revealed to be filled with pale, motionless human bodies.

choices.text: My stomach turns. I must flee now.
I have to know what this 'harvest' is.

scenes.title: A Clatter in the Flock
scenes.text: I moved along the shadowed periphery of the great station, my breath a captive in my chest. Each step was a prayer for silence. But a loose metal grate shifted under my weight, its clang a blasphemy in this holy place. A hundred heads turned, their faces serene and untroubled, their eyes fixing upon me like a blight in their fields. There was no shout, no alarm, only the unified, silent turning of the flock. I ran, their soft footfalls a gathering storm behind me.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A single figure is caught in a circle of torchlight, running across a subway platform. Dozens of robed figures are turning from their ritual to face the runner, their shadows long and distorted.

choices.text: Find a maintenance room and barricade the door.
Run deeper, into the heart of their warren.

scenes.title: The Spore's Kiss
scenes.text: My fingers brushed against the fungal plate. The texture was like cool, damp skin. A jolt, not of pain, but of communion, shot up my arm. My mind bloomed with visions not my own: a history written in root and rail, of a slumbering godhead whose nerves were the glowing mycelia and whose blood was the current in the third rail. The Root-of-Rails. It was the soil, the seed, the harvester. I felt a sense of profound, terrifying belonging. When I pulled my hand back, it was dusted with glowing green spores, a mark of favor.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A close-up from above showing a human hand touching a large, glowing green fungus on a tunnel wall. The hand itself now has a faint, glowing green residue on the fingertips.

choices.text: Accept this connection. Let it guide me.
This is a violation. I must find a way to sever it.

scenes.title: The Heretic's Map
scenes.text: I found a small alcove, a failed homestead in this underworld. A bedroll, a few tins of food, and a diary. Its pages were filled with a spidery scrawl, the testament of another soul who had stumbled into this dark pasture. They wrote of the 'wrong harvest songs' and the 'vine-that-sings'. They had tried to escape, and their final entries were a desperate attempt to map this place. One path was marked 'Surface', another, a place of great power, was circled and labeled 'The Heartwood'.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. Looking down onto a small, makeshift campsite in a tunnel nook. An open, weathered diary sits next to a flickering lantern. The diary's page shows a hand-drawn map of tunnels.

choices.text: Trust the map. Find the way to the surface.
I need leverage. I will seek out the 'Heartwood'.

scenes.title: The Abattoir-Orchard
scenes.text: I followed at a distance as they wheeled the harvested bodies into a tiled chamber, a place that might have once been a washroom. The white tiles were stained the color of rust and loam. With knives of sharpened rebar and obsidian, they began their work. It was not butchery. It was pruning. They dismembered the corpses with the focused care of a vintner, trimming away limbs and carving out organs as if to improve the yield. Each piece was placed gently into baskets woven from copper wire, all while their pastoral hymns echoed off the stained walls.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A white-tiled room where several cultists are methodically and ritualistically dismembering corpses laid out on makeshift tables. The floor is covered in blood and viscera.

choices.text: Use their gruesome work as a distraction to get past them.
Find a way to blend in. I must see where the 'yield' goes.

scenes.title: The Unbothered Shepherd
scenes.text: The metal door of the maintenance room slammed shut behind me. I rammed a length of rusted pipe through the handles, my heart a wild drum against my ribs. On the other side, the pursuit ended. There was no pounding, no shouting. Only a gentle scratching, and the sound of their soft singing, seeping through the cracks. The pipe began to glow a dull, cherry red as the metal of the door heated. They were not trying to break it down. They were merely waiting for the harvest to ripen. The door buckled inward, a wave of heat and serene, smiling faces washing over me.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. Looking straight down at a figure huddled in a small, cluttered maintenance room. The metal door at the one entrance is glowing bright orange and buckling inward, with the silhouettes of figures visible through the warped opening.

scenes.title: The Sunless Meadow
scenes.text: Deeper. I ran until my lungs burned, and stumbled into their home. A vast cistern, repurposed into a subterranean village. Tents of tarpaulin and scrap metal were arranged in concentric circles around a great, pulsating copse of the green, glowing fungus. Families were here. Children, with wide, pale eyes that had never seen a sun, tended to the fungal gardens, their small hands stroking the growths as one would a pet. The air smelled of damp soil, ozone, and something... cooking. Something familiar.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. An enormous, circular cavern is filled with a shanty town of tents and lean-tos. In the very center is a massive, intensely glowing cluster of green fungus. People, including children, move about their daily lives.

choices.text: Find one of their discarded robes and blend in.
This is an abomination. Create a diversion and fight my way out.

scenes.title: The New Shepherd
scenes.text: I did not run. The knowledge of the Root filled me, a tranquil and terrible clarity. I understood the rhythms of this place, the sweet sap of power in the rails, the necessity of the harvest. I walked from the tunnel, my hand held aloft, its green glow a beacon. The Gleaners found me, not with hostility, but with awe. They fell to their knees. They saw the blessing of the Heartwood upon me. I was no longer an intruder; I was a prophecy, a new hand to guide the pruning shears.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A lone figure stands with one hand glowing bright green. All around them, dozens of robed cultists are kneeling on the ground in reverence.

scenes.title: The Rusted Ladder
scenes.text: The heretic's map was true. It guided me through claustrophobic ducts and crumbling passageways, the air growing blessedly thin and cool. The chants faded to a memory. And then I saw it: a circle of faint, grey light high above. A manhole. A rusted iron ladder, slick with decades of grime, ascended into the world of rain and concrete. Each rung was a step away from the sunless pasture, from the harvest and the hymn. The world I knew was just a few feet away.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. The camera looks straight down a deep, circular brick shaft. At the bottom, a figure begins to climb an old, rusted metal ladder that leads up towards the light of an open manhole cover.

choices.text: Climb. Escape this nightmare.
I can't just leave them here. I have to find the 'Heartwood'.

scenes.title: The Heartwood
scenes.text: I followed the other path, towards the thrumming I now recognized as the lifeblood of this place. I found it: a massive transformer nexus, a jungle of thick cables and humming machinery, all of it overgrown and subsumed by the glowing green mycelium. The fungus pulsed in time with the electrical current, its tendrils sunk deep into the hardware. This was its heart, where the stolen power of the city above was converted into the life of the god below. The storm outside raged, and the machinery sparked, straining under the load.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A massive, complex electrical substation deep underground is completely overgrown with glowing green fungal growths. Arcs of electricity spark between transformers as a lone figure stands on a catwalk overlooking it.

choices.text: Overload the nexus. Destroy the heart.
This is too dangerous. I need to get away.

scenes.title: A Wolf Among the Flock
scenes.text: The rough-spun robe of a Gleaner settled on my shoulders like a shroud. I bowed my head and walked among them, my face hidden in shadow. I passed their fungal fields, their butcher-shrines, their quiet homes. My anonymity was a fragile shield. Then I saw the preparation for the next planting. A man, not one of them, was bound tightly in copper wire, his mouth gagged. They were watering him with the same dark fluid from the rails, humming a lullaby as they worked. I was just another shadow in the torchlight. I could pass by.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A figure in a cultist robe (the player) walks through a ritual chamber. In the center, other cultists are wrapping a struggling captive in glowing copper wires.

choices.text: Intervene. I cannot let this happen.
Keep walking. My survival is all that matters.

scenes.title: The Altar of the Rail
scenes.text: My gambit failed. Whether by sabotage or salvation, my presence was revealed. I was cornered in the main station, the one with the sigil-painted tracks. They formed a silent circle around me. Their leader, a figure draped in a mantle of severed cables and colored signal lights, stepped forward. There was no menace in its eyes, only a profound, agricultural patience. It offered a hand, its palm stained with blood and soil. A place was offered to me. A chance to be planted, to take root, to be part of the beautiful, terrible cycle.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. A lone figure is surrounded by a perfect circle of silent cultists on a subway platform. A high-priest figure, adorned with wires and lights, stands directly in front of them with a hand outstretched.

choices.text: Fight. I will not be their harvest.
Surrender. The song is too sweet to resist.

scenes.title: Surface Light
scenes.text: My hands, slick with rust and filth, found the final rung. I pushed the manhole cover aside, the screech of metal a symphony. Rain, clean and cold, washed over my face, mingling with tears. The city lights, blurred and beautiful, were the most welcome sight I had ever known. Below, the wrong songs of the harvest continued, but they were distant now, a bad dream from which I had, by some miracle, awakened. I ran, and did not look back.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. Looking down from a great height at a figure climbing out of a manhole onto a rain-slicked city street at night. The glow of streetlights and neon signs reflects in the puddles.

scenes.title: The Cleansing Spark
scenes.text: I found a rusted control panel and slammed my hands upon it. With a length of rebar, I shorted the main conduit. The storm above answered. A bolt of lightning, drawn down through the city's infrastructure, found its way to the Heartwood. The world became white light and screaming sound. The fungus withered in a flash, turning to black ash. The hum ceased. The power of the Root-of-Rails was severed, banished back to the silent earth. The resulting explosion was the last thing I felt, a final, cleansing fire.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. The entire underground transformer station is consumed in a blindingly bright white and blue electrical explosion. The fungus on the walls is vaporizing. The figure on the catwalk is just a silhouette against the blast.

scenes.title: Taking Root
scenes.text: I walked past the bound man. I did not flinch as they began their planting. I found a quiet corner in the cistern and sat. I watched the children play and the elders sing. In time, they brought me a bowl of warm, rich stew. I ate it without question. The robe ceased to be a disguise and became my skin. The hymns ceased to be their songs and became my own. I forgot the rain and the sun. I was a part of the garden now, another quiet crop, waiting for the harvest.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. The camera looks down as the player character, now wearing the cultist robe, sits cross-legged and accepting among the other cultists in their shanty town, becoming just another face in the crowd.

scenes.title: A Final, Feral Cry
scenes.text: I screamed a curse of defiance and snatched a heavy wrench from the floor. I swung it wildly, a frantic, desperate act against their placid silence. The first one I struck went down without a sound, a spray of dark blood upon the tiles. But they were a tide, and I was a single stone. They flowed over me, their hands gentle but firm, their collective weight immense. The tools of their harvest, the rebar knives and obsidian shears, found me. My final moments were a flurry of methodical, painless cuts, my blood watering the sigils on the tracks.
scenes.image_prompt: Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, bird's eye view perspective, looking down from above, flickering firelight, dancing flame illumination, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain. Looking straight down on a chaotic scene where a single figure is being overwhelmed by a crowd of cultists. Blood is splattered across the floor and the figure is being dismembered by numerous hands holding crude blades.

scenes.title: The Willing Vessel
scenes.text: My fight was gone, washed away by the ceaseless, beautiful music. I dropped to my knees and accepted the High Priest's hand. It was warm. A sense of peace, profound and absolute, settled over me. I was tired of running. I was tired of being a weed in their garden. They led me to the altar of the rail and laid me down gently. I felt the cool touch of the wire as they wrapped it around my limbs. I closed my eyes and listened to the lullaby, eagerly awaiting my planting.
